definition.en: An identified area inside the game world.

scopeNote.en: In some games they can also be worlds. Represents an aggregation of zones.

definition.en: A game controller whose input affects the action in an activity.

scopeNote.en: Game controllers are common in non-pc games. This activity represents this device.

definition.en: A non-interactive scene that can be skipped.

scopeNote.en: A cutscene is a non-interactive scene within the game (e.g., a video, a conversation, an automated sequence). The player can usually skip them pressing some button.

definition.en: An alternative presented during a conversation with an non-playable character.

scopeNote.en: Dialog trees are a common mechanic in video games, where players can answer questions to NPC. This activity represents that type of alternative.

definition.en: A game object that poses a threat inside the game world.

scopeNote.en: Enemies are common elements in video games. Defeating them indicates a player accomplishment.

definition.en: A collectable game object whose use or interaction results in an effect in a game.

scopeNote.en: Items are common elements in video games. Players can collect/use/combine them.

definition.en: A keyboard whose keystrokes affects the action in an activity.

scopeNote.en: Somes games can receive inputs from keyboards: physical keyboards in a PC, or virtual keyboards in a smartphone screen. This activity represent both.

definition.en: A level of a game or of a gamified learning platform.

scopeNote.en: A level is logic partition of progression in any video game. Completing a level means advancing in the progression of the game.

definition.en: A menu with several buttons/options whose selection produces different effects.

scopeNote.en: Represents a menu, integrated in the user interface (UI), with several a options.

definition.en: A mouse device whose clicks and movement affects the action in an activity.

scopeNote.en: PC games are usually controlled by mouse interaction. This activity represents this device.

definition.en: A character that can offer a conversation or other type of interaction inside a game.

scopeNote.en: Players usually have conversations with non-player characters.

definition.en: A accomplishable challenge or mission presented inside a game.

scopeNote.en: Completing quests marks the players' progress.

definition.en: A game screen where a concrete game task is developed.

scopeNote.en: Games are usually composed by a set of screens the player navigates. A screen has a concrete function within the game. A screen contains a menu, or the gameplay. To define virtual zones inside the game world, it is recommended to use area or zone.

definition.en: A game designed for a primary purpose other than pure entertainment. For instance, an educational game or a game-like simulation

scopeNote.en: A serious game is the root container for the rest of game elements.

definition.en: A touchscreen the player can press.
An identified zone inside an area of the game world.

scopeNote.en: A zone is inside an area, and defines a logic self-contained place.

definition.en: A game session of the serious game

scopeNote.en: A game session, and defines the characteristics of the game session in the real world in which several players can take part.

definition.en: The type of game into which the serious game is classified

scopeNote.en: defines the type of the serious game session and its characteristics

definition.en: An object whose use in the game constitutes a special in-game mechanic

scopeNote.en: An object that can be used by the user to perform one or more activities within the game

definition.en: The in-game currency, which can be used to buy and sell items.

scopeNote.en: It is the type of currency that can be used to buy items or sell items and perform other interactions that are allowed within the game economy

definition.en: A decimal number (3 significant figures with 2 figures following the decimal point) between 0 and 1 (inclusive) to indicate the value of progress in a completable.

scopeNote.en: Indicates the progress in a completable. This extension appears in the Statement's result.

definition.en: A decimal number (3 significant figures with 2 figures following the decimal point) between 0 and 1 (inclusive) to indicate the remaining health or stamina within a game.

scopeNote.en: Used to represent the remaining health of the player (e.g., number of hearts, energy bar). This extension appears in the Statement's result.

definition.en: An object with attributes x, y and z indicating the position of the player within a particular area in a game.

scopeNote.en: Used to represent the current position of the player inside the game world. This position should be expressed in a coordinate system known by the data analysts. This extension appears in the Statement's result.

definition.en: Indicates that the actor has gained access to the object.

scopeNote.en: Associated to the virtual places a player visits during a gameplay.

definition.en: Indicates that the actor made physical contact with the object.

scopeNote.en: Used when the player presses some button in an input device. Press the left button in a mouse, press the X button in a XBox controller, etc.

definition.en: Indicates that the actor released the object from one's grip from or a specific state.

scopeNote.en: Used when the player releases a previously pressed button.

definition.en: Indicates the actor unlocked an option that was previously unavailable.

scopeNote.en: Used when the player unlocks an option in an alternative.

definition.en: Indicates the actor used a virtual object.

scopeNote.en: Used when player uses items they find during the gameplay, to obtain different benefits.

definition.en: Indicates that the actor successfully completed a completable.

scopeNote.en: Used when the player successfully completes a completable, for instance, a serious game or a level.

definition.en: Indicates that the actor incorrectly completed a completable.

scopeNote.en: Used when the player completes by failing a completable, for instance, a serious game or a level.

definition.en: Indicates that the actor join a game session.

scopeNote.en: Used to determine when the actor joined a gaming session.

definition.en: Indicates that the actor stopped playing, quit or resigned.

scopeNote.en: Used when the player quits or surrenders a completable, for instance, a serious game or a level.

definition.en: Indicates that the actor earn an item or object.

scopeNote.en: Related to the rewards that can be acquired by a player.

definition.en: Indicates that an object decreased its value or quantity

scopeNote.en: Used when an objet decreased its value or quantity

definition.en: Indicates that an object increased its value or quantity

scopeNote.en: Used when an objet increased its value or quantity

definition.en: indicates that the player has sold an item or element

scopeNote.en: Used when the player has sold an item or element

definition.en: indicates that the player has bought an item or element

scopeNote.en: Used when the player has bought an item or element

definition.en: indicates that the player dragged an element from one position to another on the screen

scopeNote.en: Used when the player clicks on an element and tries to drag it to another position on the screen

definition.en: indicates that the player provides a response in a dialog or text field

scopeNote.en: Used when the player provides a response in a dialog or text field

definition.en: indicates that the player has left an area

scopeNote.en: Used when the player leaves an area
Many serious games use the Q&A mechanic to assess players. This activity covers that.
Always associated to completable activities.
Used when the player interacts with a game object in the game. Interact can be to speak, use, kill, etc.
Always associated to completable activities, and contains as result a progress value.
Used to indicate the actor skipped forward or backward while watching a video.
Used when the player selects an option in an alternative (e.g., a weapon, an arena, a circuit, a world, a quest, an answer in a dialog).
Used when the player starts a completable, for instance, a serious game or a level.
